docs.lead_paragraph: A report in the Metro Briefing column on Jan. 5 about appointments by Gov. Eliot Spitzer of New York misspelled the given name of the deputy commissioner of the Office of Health Insurance Programs, a new position. (The error was repeated on Thursday in an article about the expected appointment of a new state health commissioner.) She is Deborah Bachrach, not Debra.
docs.abstract: Correction; Jan 5 article about appointments by New York Gov Eliot Spitzer misspelled given name of commissioner; she is Deborah Bachrach

docs.lead_paragraph: We are drowning in news about Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton. So are the other candidates, including Gov. Bill Richardson of New Mexico. And Senator Clinton isn't just resting on the flood of press coverage. Her campaign is taking an aggressive approach. Her pollster sent a memo to reporters saying that the campaigns of Senator Barack Obama and John Edwards are "stalled or failing." Nonetheless, many Democrats are worried about her general election prospects.

headline.main: 2008 Like It's Today: Apres Clinton, Le Deluge

docs.abstract: We are drowning in news about Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton.

docs.lead_paragraph: The White House is getting ready for what would, under normal circumstances, be the most important speech of the year (though some would argue that his "way forward" in Iraq speech has already supplanted the State of the Union address). President Bush will address a joint session of Congress - a less friendly one than usual - Tuesday evening.

docs.lead_paragraph: DAVOS, ANYONE? The annual World Economic Forum will take place Wednesday through Sunday in Davos, Switzerland, drawing political and business leaders — plus a celebrity or two — to brainstorm solutions to world problems. Among the top issues on the agenda are climate change and the role of emerging markets. Klaus Schwab, right, the founder and executive chairman of the forum, said he hoped that this year’s conference would address a “schizophrenic world” in which there are both broad prosperity and tremendous risks from many directions.
